cyclone.name: ALEX
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (expected – presently Potential Tropical Cyclone)
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi north of the western tip of Cuba and about 300 mi southwest of Ft. Myers, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast across the southern and central Florida Peninsula Saturday, emerging into the western Atlantic north of the north-western Bahamas Saturday night, then accelerating northeast toward open Atlantic waters east of the U.S. Southeast coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: somewhere along the southwest / south-central Florida Peninsula (south of Tampa, near Naples-Fort Myers area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch for Cuban provinces of Matanzas and the Isle of Youth (no watch along Florida First Coast).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for Florida Keys, Florida Bay, west coast of Florida south of the Middle of Longboat Key, and east coast of Florida south of the Volusia/Brevard County Line to Card Sound Bridge (i.e., central and south Florida coast).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida Peninsula, especially south and central sections, then the Atlantic waters north of the Bahamas up through offshore of the Carolinas and toward Bermuda.
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty northeasterly winds late Saturday night through Sunday, with a low chance (≤3%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; most likely winds 20–30 mph with higher gusts in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal departures (<1 ft) possible Sunday on the St. Johns River and adjacent Atlantic beaches, but significant surge not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain could bring 1–3 inches to the Jacksonville area Saturday night through Sunday, locally higher in heavier squalls.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief coastal squalls and hazardous seas (6–9 ft offshore) could disrupt vessel movements; small craft conditions likely.
